comment: Dr. Jamison's online class consisted mainly of assignments (every 2 weeks or so), quizzes (every week), and 3 tests (including final). She used very dated material and seemed to put little effort into the course. Communication was abysmal and took actual months to grade. Open note tests though :/

I would not recommend taking her class. She had us get into groups at the beginning of the semester but if you missed the deadline it was a 0 even thought it was 30% of the grade. She also changed how the grades are weighted after the semester ended and it brought me from a B to a C. This did not align with the syllabus.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: DO NOT TAKE. You had to sign up for a group at the beginning of the semester in order to do the term project at the end of the semester. If you weren't able to for some reason, sorry! You get an automatic zero on a project worth 30 PERCENT of your grade. Oh and don't get me started on the automated emails and general looseness of the class. AVOID.

I am not really sure what this professor did throughout the semester. All the materials were created by someone else. I guess since it was online, those students didn't deserve any recording of the lectures or the same level of interaction with the professor. I will give KSU 1 more chance to show me a decent instructor. or I will be changing majors

Course was a mess from start to finish, grading was haphazard,   content was ancient (very outdated) professor seemed to be "phoning it in." Used automated emails instead of actually interacting with her clsss.This is a required course, but it shouldn't be. Waste of time. Also, be aware that the prerequisites need to include SQL, but don't.

She would skip grading multiple assignments. Used outdated information and materials. Was very disorganized. Assignments had typos or contradictions. No feedback on assignments and if there was, it was copied and pasted with a grade that did not reflect it. The good part was that she gave 100s on assignments very generously.

"Web and Mobile App Security"'s  content  was hopelessly outdated, do much so that most of the assignments were broken as written. Teacher is a disorganized mess and provided just single-word feedback for all work.  Also, the prerequisites for the course should have included SQL and Linux. (Expect to teach yourself those to be able to do the work)

Took her for both IT Policy & Law and Operating Systems for the first time this semester and overall it was good, ended with 100s in both courses. I will say that she admits that having her in person is way better than having her online so if you take her I would recommend the in-person section all the way.

Teacher seemed enthusiastic about class initially but then seemed to constantly undermine herself and the class throughout the semester. Policies were haphazard and capricious, grading was delayed and inconsistent.  Correct answers to quizzes were never provided.(so the same mistakes were made on quiz after quiz). Discussions were set invisible.

I dont write this based on course content at all, this is the worst professor Ive had at Kennesaw. Unorganized is an understatement, late to class and wouldnt even know what were doing ever. Rude, even mentioned a fatphobic comment to the whole class!!! Slandering overweight people. Gave us answers to tests, learned NOTHING!!!! 0/10. Geez

Disgraceful class. all she provides for learning materials is slides from the textbook company (over 100 slides per module) and bad links. She has a crazy discussion policy where you lose more points for responding to a post at an incorrect time than if you don't respond at all. control freak, You are completely on your own in her class.

I heard she is great in person, but online, the class is a trainwreck. Exams were locked days after they were supposed to be accessible. The discussion post and replies have to be 24 hours apart, which is not that bad but it's annoying when she takes 30 points off your discussion post for not posting before Friday when it's due Sunday.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: A lot of the reviews on here aren't great, but I'm taking her online for IT4723 and she's fine. The only complaint I have is that she grades assignments very slowly. She mostly has old pp slides and links posted, but it seems that's what all professors are doing right now. This course is pretty straightforward. Turn stuff in on time, and youre fine

1)Only reads slides 2)Obviously unprepared to ACTUALLY teach. Constantly changed the course schedule without announcement. My advice? Read the slides prior and bring specific questions. Attend reviews to know what on the Exam. She's a nice person. Bad teacher.

She's a very nice instructor but poorly organized when it comes to assignments. Relies on old, pre-made powerpoints that she just reads from and external articles to teach. You don't really learn anything and all the assignments and discussion posts are literally just papers. Pretty pointless class. Maybe if she did more teaching and engagement.

I didnt realize I was signing up for another English class. This class has you write papers just about every week over material you dont even have to read or go over. This class relies heavily on you writing a certain amount of length so that she can just give out 100s. Wasnt expecting much out of this class and Im not suprised

Professor Jamison is a kind lady but makes her class very complicated when it comes to grading. The way she has the class do the useless discussion posts is so inconvenient and organized that she even gets messed up by her own system. Like every other professor here, she relies on the powerpoints to do the teaching which in fact does not teach.

Do not take her. Mrs. J may be nice but EXTREMELY unorganized. Do not trust the syllabus. Homework referenced material to be covered after its due date (so read ahead) and quiz topics were often uncertain (and covered "optional" modules). Weekly work was unbalanced--some very heavy, others light. She answers emails at random. Overall, unorganized.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy
